item.title: Blog 1: Rethinking Coalignment from Ground-up
item.description: The Very Essence of Coalignment At its core, coalignment is all about making sure our solar images match up as best they can. It uses a few different techniques, like template matching and solar rotation correction, to get this done. This is really important when we’re trying to accurately track and study what’s happening on a part of sun over time. We re-thought the entire process of what our new API be providing to the users as well as its structure.

item.title: Journey to Google Summer of Code 2024
item.description: Hey Jayraj, What’s your story about getting into GSoC? One of the most repeatedly asked question since the contributor results got announced by Google. All right peeps, lets do this one last time ;) What is GSoC you say? Well, Google Summer of Code (GSoC) is a global program focused on bringing more student developers into open source software development. Students work with an open-source organization on a 12+ week programming project during summer.

item.title: Blog 0: The First Two Weeks
item.description: A summary of activities completed in the two weeks leading up to the start of the coding period. Table of Contents Wrapping up the draft pull request Incorporating suggestions for STARA & its examples Fixing the doc failures First Meet with Mentors After completing my end-semester exams, I was overwhelmed by the outstanding tasks that I had let accumulate over time. In order to address those, I tried resolving dependencies and package issues of the previous environments of sunpy & sunkit-image but, ultimately gave up and initialised a new environment.
